channel.title: Did You Know on Indalit Cloud Consulting
channel.description: Recent content in Did You Know on Indalit Cloud Consulting

item.title: AWS DynamoDB Replication
item.description: Did you know AWS DynamoDB provides you with a fully managed, multi-region, and multi-master database? Your tables can be automatically replicated across regions.

item.title: AWS Aurora Multi Master Multi AZ
item.description: Did you know that with Amazon Aurora you can have multiple master EC2 Instances across multiple AZ?

item.title: Amazon EBS Volumes Delete on Instance Termination
item.description: Did you know that by default Amazon Web Services EBS root device volumes are automatically deleted when the instance terminates? This is also the case with ephemeral storage (instance store volumes). Other non root EBS volumes are not deleted. You can configure your instance so it doesn’t delete the EBS root device volumes with the DeleteOnTermination attribute.

item.title: AWS VPC To Span Across AZs
item.description: Did you know that a subnet cannot span multiple AWS Availability Zones while a VPC can?

item.title: AWS Has Launched a New General Purpose Instance Family, M5
item.description: Did you know AWS EC2 has a new General Purpose instance family, M5? Check if available in your region.

item.title: AWS Launches Fargate, Containers without EC2 Instances
item.description: Did you know Amazon launched AWS Fargate? The new AWS Fagate service allows for deployment and management of containers without having to build a cluster of EC2 Instances.

item.title: AWS Aurora Relational Database in the Cloud
item.description: Did you know Amazon Aurora will enable you to run your Relational Database in the Cloud without managing any instances or clusters?

item.title: AWS Cross Region VPC Peering
item.description: Did you know AWS now allows VPC Peering across different regions?

item.title: AWS Introduces Spread Placement Groups
item.description: Did you know AWS introduced Spread Placement Groups? This means AWS EC2 Instances within a Placement Group will be on distinct hardware.

item.title: AWS Lightsail Launches Load Balancing Support
item.description: Did you know Amazon Lightsail has added support for Load Balancers with integrated certificate management?

item.title: AWS Glacier Expedite Retrieval Options
item.description: Did you know you have two options when choosing Expedited Retrieval on AWS Glacier? You can choose on-demand or provisioned.

item.title: AWS New Compute Optimized Instance Family - C5
item.description: Did you know AWS EC2 has a new Compute Optimized instance family, C5? Check if available in your region.

item.title: AWS EC2 EBS Encryption of Boot Volume
item.description: Did you know the Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) boot volume can be encrypted?

item.title: AWS S3 Encryption SSE-C
item.description: Did you know Amazon S3 SSE-C means Server Side Encryption with Customer-Provided Keys?

item.title: AWS Deleting the Queue After 30 Days
item.description: Did you know if an AWS SQS queue does not receive certain requests for more than 30 days, AWS reserves the right to delete the queue?

item.title: AWS RDS Multi Availability Zone Deployment
item.description: Did you know with an Amazone RDS Multi-AZ deployment, the standby cannot be used for read or write operations?

item.title: AWS EC2 Ephemeral Storage
item.description: Did you know when an Amazon EC2 instance with ephemeral store volumes is stopped, the data is lost?

item.title: AWS RDS Database Read Replicas
item.description: Did you know that with Amazon RDS you can create Read Replicas from an another Read Replica and have the replication handled between them? This reduces the load on the master.

item.title: AWS EC2 Instances T2 VPC
item.description: Did you know you cannot launch an AWS T2 instance type in an AWS EC2-Classic platform? You must launch it in a VPC.

item.title: AWS Glacier Expedite
item.description: Did you know there is an option to expedite the retrieval of an Amazon Glacier archive within minutes?

item.title: AWS EC2 Instances Public IP
item.description: Did you know an Amazon EC2 Instance retains its private IP addresses when it is stopped? This is not the case for the public IP address which is released when the instance is stopped.

item.title: AWS EC2 Intances Metadata
item.description: Did you know that viewing the following link on an AWS EC2 Instance will give you the metadata of your instance? http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/

item.title: AWS Glacier Minimum Pricing
item.description: Did you know if you delete an archive from Amazon Glacier less than 90 days after it was uploaded you will still pay 90 days of storage for it?

item.title: AWS Auto Scaling Cooldown Period
item.description: Did you know the default AWS Auto Scaling cooldown period is 300 seconds? When AWS Auto Scaling launches a new instance, it will wait 300 seconds before launching a new one.

item.title: AWS Auto Scaling Termination Policy
item.description: Did you know when you use the default termination policy with AWS Auto Scaling it doesn’t terminate the instance with the oldest launch configuration automatically? It first tries to balance the number of instances across Availability Zones, then picks the Availability Zone with the most instances and terminates the instance with the oldest launch configuration. If there are more than one, then it ends the process by randomly picking the instance to terminate.
